New Records: Golden State Warriors struggled from the three-point line, making 8 out of 29 attempts in the game.
Key Match Events: Miami Heat's zone defense led to Golden State Warriors' struggles, with Steph Curry scoring 8 threes but the rest of the team struggling to 6-of-33 (18.1 percent) from the arc.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. and Nikola Jovic played pivotal roles, with Jaquez Jr. scoring 18 points and Jovic contributing 20 points.
The game turned on a sequence where the Heat made three consecutive threes after the Warriors missed three shots, expanding the lead to double digits.
Pre-Game Insights: The Heat employed a zone defense strategy, effective against the Warriors' smaller lineup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was marked by a slow start and the Heat's ability to exploit the Warriors' defensive lapses.
